taxonomicName.emphasis: Hypopleuron caninum Smith & Radcliffe in Radcliffe 1913

subSubSection.paragraph: Meristics. Dorsal-fin rays 141–151; anal-fin rays 110–118; pectoral-fin rays 22–25; pelvic-fin ray 1; caudal-fin rays 7–8; branchiostegal rays 8; abdominal vertebrae 22–24; total vertebrae 97–101; developed gill rakers on first arch 3; median basibranchial tooth patch 1.

Measurements (%SL). Head 15.8–20.2; snout 3.5–4.8; upper jaw 6.8–8.4; horizontal eye 2.9–3.3; interorbital 2.1–4.1; body depth 9.7–13.4; predorsal 16.0–19.8; pectoral fin 11.7–13.3; pelvic fin 2.3–3.4; preanal 40.6–46.2; caudal fin 2.5–4.2.

Color when fresh (photographed just after capture) ( Fig. 1 ).
Head and body pale brown dorsally, whitish laterally and ventrally. Pectoral fin brown with whitish base. Dorsal, anal and caudal fins uniformly black.

Color after formalin fixation. Head and body dark dorsally. Infraorbital, cheek, and branchiostegal membrane pale. Abdominal area whitish, becoming yellowish posteriorly. All fins dark, dorsal and anal fins darker posteriorly.
